meanings.definition: A soft felt hat with a curled brim and indented crown.
meanings.sent1: He tipped his fedoras to greet the guests at the party.
meanings.sent2: The detective always wore his fedoras when solving mysteries.
meanings.sent3: The fedoras at the store looked like they were whispering secrets to each other.
meanings.sent4: The fedoras in the shop stood tall like guardians of fashion.
meanings.sent5: The fedoras on display seemed to have their own personalities, each unique and stylish.

meanings.definition: A style of hat typically worn by men.
meanings.sent1: The old movies often featured men in fedoras, looking very dapper.
meanings.sent2: He bought a new fedoras to match his suit for the wedding.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to wear one of the fedoras in the house, thinking it made him look sophisticated.
meanings.sent4: His fedoras became his signature look, adding an air of mystery to his persona.
meanings.sent5: The fedoras on the rack seemed to beckon to him, each one promising a touch of elegance.
